result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kenneth Lee Payne was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

With full Huber.
Court grants furlough for Saturday, January 26 to attend wake/funeral for Glenda McIntyre in Beloit. 
Upon successful completion of alcohol and drug treatment program through the Department of Corrections, defendant may petition for early release from jail.
**8/27/19- Court grants balance of Jail Sentence Stayed**

02:06 PM Defendant Kenneth Lee Payne in court in custody with attorney Philip J. Brehm.  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty. Pre sentence investigation waived.  Court orders sentence withheld, 3 years probation, 1 year conditional jail time with full Huber, Court grants furlough for Saturday to attend wake/funeral for Glenda McIntyre in Beloit, 48 month drivers license revocation, 48 month ignition interlock device, AODA, 30 days sentence credit if revoked, $1200 fine plus costs due March 28, 2019, defendant may petition for early release from jail upon successful completion of AODA treatment program through DOC.
